text.base: You stand at the edge of the Kaltvik cliffs. Below, the sea churns like black oil. A car lies crumpled at the base, its headlights still flickering.

lens.believer: The flickering lights feel like a signal. A call from the depths that you can't ignore.
lens.skeptic: The safety railing is sheared clean. High-speed impact. No skid marks. Likely deliberate.
lens.haunted: The cold wind carries a familiar scent—lavender and burnt rubber. It makes your teeth ache.

text.base: The smell of gasoline is overpowering. The car—a silver sedan—is twisted around a jagged rock. The driver's door is open, swinging in the wind.

lens.believer: The interior is glowing with a faint, pulsing blue light. It's not electricity. It's something else.
lens.skeptic: The airbag deployed but is covered in a dark, viscous fluid. Not blood. Oil? Or something more corrosive?
lens.haunted: The radio is static-hissing a melody you haven't heard since childhood. Your mother used to hum it.

inserts.text: The angle of the door suggests the driver didn't fall out. They jumped.

choices.label: Follow the trail into the cave

text.base: Four parallel lines of rubber scorched into the asphalt. They don't point toward the cliff. They point away, then loop back.

lens.skeptic: Test driving? Some kind of high-speed maneuver before the final plunge.

text.base: You pry open the glovebox. Inside is a single envelope, sealed with red wax. The name 'Kaltvik' is written on the front in a shaking hand.

lens.skeptic: Looks like a standard legal document. Or a confession.
lens.believer: The wax is warm. It feels like it's holding something... alive... inside.

text.base: 'If you're reading this, the integration has already begun. Don't look for me. I'm already part of the static.' The ink is still wet.

lens.haunted: This is your handwriting. You know it is.

choices.label: Tuck the letter into your coat

text.base: The walls are covered in a bioluminescent lichen. It pulses in time with the hum. In the center of the chamber is a pedestal made of the same silver metal as the car.

lens.believer: It's an altar. They were sacrificing more than just a car here.

text.base: As you touch the metal, the lichen turns from blue to a blinding white. The hum becomes a scream. You see a face in the metal—not the driver's, but your own.

lens.haunted: You remember now. You didn't arrive today. You've been here for months.

text.base: Thank you for playing the Tyger Tyger Liar Liar Vertical Slice. The investigation continues soon.
